content.description: This climb is 5.8 or 5.9 with a 5.10 sequence from the huge ledge to the next jug.
content.protection: 4 bolts to chains with rap rings
content.location: Starts on the right side of the blocky face on the West side of the formation next to an arete.

climbs.name: Victoria's Secret
climbs.fa: Jeffrey Thomas, Sandy Champagne, Pam Neal, & Ben Chapman (February 14, 2015)

content.description: Begin climbing on small square holds and flakes. Above the 3rd bolt move left. Continue up on thin, but positive flakes. As the wall steepens move left and pull the large black bulge on rounded holds. Continue up the slab to the anchor.
content.location: Left side of the wall, just right of the arete and the gulley.

content.description: Climb interesting sloped blocks (5.9) past three bolts to a massive ledge. The very challenging crux is after clipping the fourth bolt above the ledge. There are some questionable flexing holds on the top half of this route.
content.protection: 6 bolts, rap ring on chained anchor.
content.location: Middle of the three routes on the West side of Valentine Wall.

content.description: Scramble up a ramp to a small boulder. Slightly confusing to get off the boulder, then climb 5.9 to the third bolt. Walk across a large ledge to the almost vertical second half of the route. Crux is between the fourth and six bolts.
content.location: Far right side of Valentine wall facing West.

content.description: Stem the polished slab and overhang. Utilize the crack/slot to pull the bulge and climb the right facing reddish corner, on flakes and features, to its end. Near the top pull flakes and features to reach the two bolt anchor.
content.location: Left side of the wall, on the overhung right wall of the cavernous gulley.

climbs.name: Magic Mushroom
climbs.fa: Dwain Porter, Joshua Horn, Mikey Griffits, Caitlin Jones

content.description: Beautiful shiny low angle slab on the top half of this route.  Very easy blocks take you to the smooth slab.  Good beginner lead.
content.protection: Bolts to double bolt anchors with rapid links for rappelling.
content.location: Not actually on Valentine Wall.  This route starts on the south side of the crag near the three campsites.

content.description: Begin climbing the right face of an oblique corner formed by a dark pillar. Climb the face to the right of the pillar, then work through a well featured low angle area to the base of the steep upper arete. Climb up the arete and face as it trends right to the anchor.

Begin climbing below the serrated flake, that begins ten feet above the base, on small handholds and polished slab for the feet. After attaining the flake, move left past the 1st bolt and continue up the face on positive edges. As the angle steepens work up to a deep hueco and then right to a crack. Climb the featured face, left of the crack, with large flakes and knobs to the anchor.
content.location: Right side of the Valentine Wall, ten feet right of the crack and below the serrated flake that begins ten feet above the base.

content.description:
The start of this climb is below the crack between Cupids Fever and Victoria's Secret. You'll see 2 bolts, the first a little high but the climbing is solid.

Climb up the two bolts which then lead to the crack. Pretty straight forward climb up the crack, with features to pull/step on if you need them. You can protect it with one or two pieces.

Once you pull onto the ledge, you climb up the wall on your right, clipping another bolt and eventually passing  the anchors for Cupid's Fever to reach two bolted anchors about 10ft higher.

Fun mixed sport/trad route, solid practice for someone trying to get into placing protection.
content.location: Two bolts below a crack. Found between Cupid's Fever and Victoria's Secret
